title: Opal Creek Forest Preserve Act of 1994
content: Opal Creek Forest Preserve Act of 1994 - Establishes the Opal Creek Forest Preserve consisting of Federal lands in the Willamette and Mt. Hood National Forests, Oregon. Directs the Secretary of Agriculture to prepare a Preserve management plan. Prohibits, with specified exceptions: (1) mining, mineral, and geothermal leasing or dispositions, (2) logging or other timber harvesting, (3) off road motorized travel. And (4) road construction and the use of specified existing roads. Authorizes the Secretary to acquire private lands within the Preserve.
